boatwithrank.short_description: 'Straight Across' was built to the Everyman design, but lengthened to 30' 2" from the standard 28'.

boatwithrank.name: Maid Marian
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Maid Marian' was built in 1908 by Crossfields at Arnside as a yacht for Joe Twynould, proprietor of the Star Restaurant, Morecambe.

boatwithrank.name: Sheila
boatwithrank.short_description: Sheila was Albert Strange's first deep-keel yacht commission, for the artist Robert Groves to sail in the western isles of Scotland. She was built in 1905 and is probably the oldest Strange yacht.

boatwithrank.name: Poppy
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Poppy' is a unique modern wooden classic, built, 2002 by her designer, Fabian Bush. Her design, construction and finish emulate the Victorian sailing canoes popular in the late 19th century. She is eminently suited to trailer sailing.

boatwithrank.name: Sunbeam
boatwithrank.short_description: A first class Whitstable smack, rebuilt in 1982 by John Rigby.

boatwithrank.name: Katie
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1889 by Aldous at Brightlingsea, 'Katie' worked for oysters the Salcott and Tollesbury area and was converted to a yacht by Johnson & Jago of Leigh-on-Sea in the 1930s.

boatwithrank.name: Minx
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Minx' is a GRP Morecambe Bay Prawner built from a mould taken from the 'William Priestley' the Morecambe Bay Fishermen's Association's private lifeboat which served from 1934 to 1989. She was launched in 1993.

boatwithrank.name: Ploughboy
boatwithrank.short_description: Ploughboy was built as a yacht for John Jackson of Walney Island as a replacement for Cock O'North which was wrecked on her maiden voyage. In 1960s and 70s she was owned by John Gill a house master at Rossall School south of Fleetwood and used to take pupils on sailing trips. She is now based in North Wales

boatwithrank.name: Rosebud
boatwithrank.short_description: Rosebud is a Falmout Quay Punt type designed by John Hesp and built in steel in 2000

boatwithrank.name: Florinda
boatwithrank.short_description: Originally called 'Kathleen' and kept at Pin Mill, she was renamed 'Florinda' by her second owners and kept initially at Waldringfield on the Deben, then at Aldburgh.

boatwithrank.name: Roma
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Roma' was built in 1907 of pitch pine on massive oak frames as a salmon fishing boat. No two timbers are the same distance apart, clearly built by eye. Converted to a yacht in 1919 with two berths.  The new owner , in Barcelona, has renamed the boat Roamer as orginally named.

boatwithrank.name: Bloodaxe
boatwithrank.short_description: Bloodaxe is a steel double-chine sailing cruiser with a raked and rounded stem and canoe stern, Hull, deck, and superstructure are steel, laid in a flush carvel style.

boatwithrank.name: Asti V
boatwithrank.short_description: Built for the 1932 Olympics

boatwithrank.name: Tom Tit
boatwithrank.short_description: Built at Fay's Yard, but built by Cave, Yachting World (1894) describes her as an Itchen Ferry Yacht.

boatwithrank.name: Aberrare
boatwithrank.short_description: Aberrare is an Aber dinghy designed by Francois Vivier in the spirit of the traditional Breton craft.

boatwithrank.name: George and Alice
boatwithrank.short_description: 'George and Alice' was a commercial fishing boat, no. CK76, working out of Brightlingsea oyster dredging, stowboating and inshore trawling.

boatwithrank.name: Carabella of Wight
boatwithrank.short_description: Carabella of Wight is a Cheverton Caravel Mark lll built of African Mahogany

boatwithrank.name: Diamond
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Diamond' is a replica of a 1897 Sibbick fin and bulb half rater.

boatwithrank.name: Windflower
boatwithrank.short_description: Similar to the designer's XOD but larger

boatwithrank.name: Nightfall
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Nightfall' is a shoal-draft gaff cutter and was built for WD Silcock and his wife to gently sail on the Norfolk Broads and around the Suffolk Coast. She was designed by Harold Lidston who lived in Cowes.

boatwithrank.name: Kate
boatwithrank.short_description: Kate is a Memory 19, a shoal draft, gaff rigged cutter, designed by Tony Robinson RINA. She is based on the design of Brightlingsea working craft around the 1920s.

boatwithrank.name: Molly
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 2003, Molly is a modern replica of a New Bedford whaleboat designed by Charles Beetle.

boatwithrank.name: Nomad
boatwithrank.short_description: Designed by Ed Burnet and Nigel Irens and built by Fairlie Restorations on the Hamble in 1997, 'Nomad' was transported to New Zealand and then sailed to Australia.

boatwithrank.name: Moon River
boatwithrank.short_description: Moon River is a Yarmouth 23 gaff rigged cutter built in 2001. Based on the Solent, she took part in the OGA Round Britain Challenge, 2013, sailed single-handed by skipper Barbara Runnalls.

boatwithrank.name: Deva
boatwithrank.short_description: Deva's design and hull shape are typical of the 'advanced' design of prawners in the pre-First World War era.

boatwithrank.name: Secret
boatwithrank.short_description: Secret is a Smack Yacht built by Shuttlewood in 1932

boatwithrank.name: Bries
boatwithrank.short_description: A Boeier Aak leeboard yacht

boatwithrank.name: Molly Cobbler
boatwithrank.short_description: A modern interpretation of a 1920s Mevagissy Tosher.

boatwithrank.name: Margherita
boatwithrank.short_description: Margherita is a Shilling class yacht, built in 2008 by Willow Bay boats. The 17ft hull is cedar strip on plywood frames and she is immensely strong, fast and seaworthy for her size. Based in Poole, she attends OGA events, including the 50th anniversary rally at Cowes in 2013 and OGA55 in 2018.

boatwithrank.name: Ventosa
boatwithrank.short_description:
9.9m Sloop rig

First 32s5

boatwithrank.name: Kate
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Kate' was launched in 1883 with fishing no. CK139. She continued to work as an oyster dredger, under power, as late as the 1960s. Her current fishing no. is CK52.

boatwithrank.name: LadybBird
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1974, her hull is from a mould of the Itchen Ferry 'Nellie'. Having fallen into disrepair, she was rescued in 2015 and her owner is undertaking a full restoration at the Royal Northumberland Yacht Club yard. The odd spelling of LadybBird is an attempt to negate the 'name change hex' by combining the double 'b' of Bushy Barnaby (an old Norfolk word for ladybird

boatwithrank.name: Syrinx
boatwithrank.short_description: One of 3 Broads Yachts built to the same design by W.S.Parker on Oulton Broad.

boatwithrank.name: Dawn
boatwithrank.short_description: Dawn was designed by a pupil of Albert Strange. Her lines are published in Yachting Monthly July 1905.

boatwithrank.name: Ruby
boatwithrank.short_description: 17ft.6in. half decker. Sail No. CW-143 . Ivory/Cream hull Gaff sloop with tan sails.

boatwithrank.name: Ruby
boatwithrank.short_description: Re-named 'Ruby', this classic half-decker built in 1910 has raced with the OGA since the 1970s when she was called 'Alan'.

boatwithrank.name: Trammel
boatwithrank.short_description: Trammel is an Itchen Ferry type yacht built in 1949

boatwithrank.name: Vashti
boatwithrank.short_description: Designed by Alan Buchanan, Vashti was built at Burnham on Crouch by Priors in 1958.

builderByBuilder.name: R. and J. Prior and Son Ltd.

boatwithrank.name: Mascotte
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Mascotte', reputed to be the largest pilot cutter in the Bristol Channel, has a fascinating history. Since her centenary she has been used for filmwork and charter, overwintering in Gloucester and based in Scotland during the summer.

boatwithrank.name: Ocean Pearl
boatwithrank.short_description: Built between the wars, 'Ocean Pearl' has a chequered history.

boatwithrank.name: Dragonfly
boatwithrank.short_description: Norfolk Broads Yacht, 'Dragonfly' was built by Bunn in 1905.

boatwithrank.name: Random
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1930 by Harry Feltham, 'Random' is a one-off, originally Bermudan rigged. In 2011 she was converted to gaff rig. Sadly, lost in a fire, 2016.

boatwithrank.name: Mrs Mouse
boatwithrank.short_description: Mrs Mouse is an Oysterman 22 built in 1987.

boatwithrank.name: Ripple
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in the Isle of Wight, 1902, Ripple has sailed in the Solent, Scotland and spent some time in India. She's now based in Dartmouth, Devon.

boatwithrank.name: Molly G
boatwithrank.short_description: She is a fine example of her type.

boatwithrank.name: Unity of Lynn
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Unity of Lynn' is a smack built to fish out of Kings Lynn, 1906.

boatwithrank.name: Guillemot
boatwithrank.short_description: Guillemot is a new build, made to look as traditional as possible.

boatwithrank.name: Amelie Rose
boatwithrank.short_description: Amelie Rose was built in 2009 by Luke Powell, a replica Scillonian pilot cutter, to provide classic charter opportunities.

boatwithrank.name: Sophie
boatwithrank.short_description: Sophie was originally built as a Falmouth Quay punt and later converted to a yacht, spending a short period of time with Bermudan rig.

boatwithrank.name: Patsy
boatwithrank.short_description: Pronounced beyond economic repair around 1990, but a replica hull was built and "Patsy" is still sailing today.

boatwithrank.name: Ceres
boatwithrank.short_description: Ceres is a one-off gaff rigged yawl with a sail plan designed by Maurice Griffiths.

boatwithrank.name: Squiggles
boatwithrank.short_description: Squiggles is a modified Cape Henry design.

boatwithrank.name: Eljada
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Eljada' [named after a warrior from The Old Testament ] is a Bermudan ketch motor sailor and was built of iroko on oak for a British Army officer about 1964 by Staniland's of Thorn near Doncaster, Yorkshire.

boatwithrank.name: Liffin
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Liffin' is an East Anglian Bermudan mast head sloop.

boatwithrank.name: Charity
boatwithrank.home_port: Walton on the Naze and Pin Mill
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by Ashton and Kilner, Poole, designed by LH Ashton. Canoe stern cutter, 30 ft on deck, currently Bermudan, possibly to become gaff cutter, watch this space!

boatwithrank.name: Dolce Vita
boatwithrank.short_description: Dolce Vita is a Memory Class built in 1977 and re-built 2006-7.

boatwithrank.name: Lona II
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Lona II' is a miniature racing yacht of the period. She was lovingly maintained by her owner, Richard Meynell to become a consistent councours winner, frequently featuring in yachting magazines. As well as being extremely pretty, 'Lona II' is a race winner and was sold to an owner in Italy, 2004, where she still sails.

boatwithrank.name: Phyllis
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Phyllis' has been painstakingly restored and sails in the Humber. She is on the National Register of Historic Vessels.

boatwithrank.name: Verity
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Verity' is an Oysterman 16 built in 1984, No. 15 in a series of boats built by Riverside Projects in Penryn.

boatwithrank.name: Isadora
boatwithrank.short_description: Isadora is a lovely open day boat.

boatwithrank.name: Elizabeth Mary
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Elizabeth Mary' was built at Looe, Cornwall by Pearce in 1908, allegadly as a Plymouth hooker. Her owner in 1977, Trevor Vincett, suggests she was more likely a Polperro gaffer.

boatwithrank.name: Felix
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Felix' is a cat boat, designed by Andrew Wolstenholme and built by David Moss Boatbuilders in 1982.

boatwithrank.name: Hegri
boatwithrank.short_description: Hegri is a Koalen 17 - a Francois Vivier design.

boatwithrank.name: Polly Garter
boatwithrank.short_description: Named after a 'loose woman' in a play by Dylan Thomas, 'Polly Garter' is a Cornish Crabber Mark 1, launched in 1978.

boatwithrank.name: Mayblossom
boatwithrank.short_description: Mayblossom is a New Blossom Class Yacht designed by John Leather and built in 1973. She carries a Tohatsu 9.8 hp and a silver century seagull 5 hp. She is 2 berth, has a head, sink and gas cooker making her ideal for short trips away.

builderByBuilder.name: Patten P or Gale H. and Sons

boatwithrank.name: Brandaen
boatwithrank.short_description: According to her skipper 'Brandaen is a real eye-catcher. She is very fast, stable and in spite of her size, easy to handle for two persons.' Built of steel in Brightlingsea, 1980, she's currently based in the Netherlands.

boatwithrank.name: Tabnab
boatwithrank.short_description: Gaff cutter built with GRP hull with ply deck and topsides on traditional West Country lines.

boatwithrank.name: Mischief
boatwithrank.short_description: In 1924 the 'W' Boats were designed by H. Jacobs and H.G. May of the Berthon Boat Company in Lymington, as one-design cruiser racers. Berthon is a West Solent One Design, Berthon Build no. 360, built in 1930.

boatwithrank.name: Dipper
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Dipper' is a Broads One Design, built in 1986.

boatwithrank.name: Jubilee
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1935 'Jubilee' has always been a common sight on the River Deben and along the East Coast.

boatwithrank.name: Hardy
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1910 by Summers & Payne, Southampton as a cruising yacht, Hardy was designed by A.E Payne Junior, probably as his largest commission, and is cutter rigged.

boatwithrank.name: Nellie B
boatwithrank.short_description: Teak decks were added soon after her launch and the main mast altered to cutter from sloop in 2009 when mast was replaced. The mizzen remains unchanged.

boatwithrank.name: Moya
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by William Crossfield, Arnside in 1910, 'Moya' is a 43ft Morecambe Bay Prawner, or Nobby, based in the Mediterranean.

boatwithrank.name: Pudding Faces
boatwithrank.short_description: Mould for the hull was taken from one of the last wooden dinghies built by Alf Last.

boatwithrank.name: Styx
boatwithrank.short_description: Abandoned, taking on water and finally sinking early in 1986, 'Styx' was in danger of being destroyed to recover mooring fees. She was rescued following an appeal in the OGA Newsletter and taken back to the Mersey in 1986.

boatwithrank.name: Piskie
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Piskie' is a Falmouth Quay Punt designed and built by R S Burt, Falmouth, 1912 as 'Venture'. First fitted with an engine in 1933.

boatwithrank.name: Moonshine
boatwithrank.short_description: Moonshine is a Norfolk Smuggler built in 1996

boatwithrank.name: Tanyss
boatwithrank.short_description: Tanyss is a 12' sailing dinghy of unknown type

boatwithrank.name: Freya
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Freya', a Yarmouth 23, was built in Yarmouth IOW, launched 2001. In 2011 she was taken to the Adriatic by road and sailed down the Dalmatian coast to Corfu, where she cruised until 2014 before returning to Cornwall.

boatwithrank.name: Ragamuffin
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Ragamuffin' is a Heard 28, built by Terry Heard in 1970, Mylor, Cornwall. She has been kept in the Netherlands since the late 1970s.

boatwithrank.name: Peggotty
boatwithrank.short_description: Peggotty is 27' overall length (excluding bowsprit) drawing 3' 8'' draft. Built by N. Nisbet, Newcastle on Tyne, in 1930.

boatwithrank.name: Three Sisters
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in Thorpeness as a beach fishing punt, 1896, for a Mr Ralph, she has been rebuilt by Robert Simper and takes part in traditional events on the River Deben.

boatwithrank.name: Ludwen
boatwithrank.short_description: Ludwen is a Cornish Crabber Mark 1 built in 1976.

boatwithrank.name: Nutmeg
boatwithrank.short_description: Nutmeg was built in 1996 as Rebecca. She is a Sea Otter design and a winner at the Wooden Boat Show at Greenwich 1996.

boatwithrank.name: Annelis
boatwithrank.short_description: Annelis is a 40ft, ferrocement, gaff ketch. She was originally built and fitted out over a period of 12 years, spanning the 1980s. Her lines are based on a Falmouth pilot cutter, and she is rigged traditionally, with wooden spars and heavy sails. In 2013 young gaffers Josh Masters and Sam Doman began an extensive rebuild.

boatwithrank.name: Cautious Clara
boatwithrank.short_description: Cautious Clara was built as a yacht in 1910.

boatwithrank.name: Clearwater
boatwithrank.short_description:
'Clearwater' is a Tamarisk 29, the lines of which were taken directly from one of the fastest and most sea-kindly of the Falmouth Working Boats.

The hull was built by Cygnus Marine in Penryn and fitted out by North Cornwall Marine in St.Columb.

boatwithrank.name: Susan J
boatwithrank.short_description:
Susan J is a Heard 28, built in 1991 by Gaffers and Luggers and has cruised extensively.

susanjcutter@blogspot.com

boatwithrank.name: Meander
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by her first owner as a liveaboard and sailed to the Caribean in 1993, Meander is a ferro cement gaff ketch. Her hull design is based on American North East Coast working vessels, and she has a traditional British style gaff ketch rig with tan sails.

boatwithrank.name: Horta
boatwithrank.short_description: Horta is a Walker Tideway dinghy built in 1973.

boatwithrank.name: Hazelisle
boatwithrank.short_description: Designed by Francis Jones, 'Hazelisle' is a classic 'one-off' built to 100 A1 at Lloyds in 1952

boatwithrank.name: Marie Louise
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1978, an Oysterman 16, 'Marie Louise' is a regular winner in OGA events.

boatwithrank.name: Peggy
boatwithrank.short_description: A pocket cruiser with a generous sail plan and small cabin, ideal for   exploring shallow creeks.

boatwithrank.name: Sea Pig
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Sea Pig' was built in 1930 by Eversons of Woodbridge, Suffolk and has the class and sail number 4.

boatwithrank.name: La Pastora
boatwithrank.short_description:
A Memory 19 sailing yacht. 

2 berth cabin version. 

Restored and in good condition.

boatwithrank.name: Stormy Petrel
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Stormy Petrel' was built in Whitsable, Kent, 1890 by Dick and Charlie Perkins. Until 1928 she fished for the famed Thames oysters.

boatwithrank.name: Mignonette
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1946, 'Mignonette' is a Maurice Griffiths Lone Gull design and has been restored by Professor Mark Horton.

boatwithrank.name: Tidebird
boatwithrank.short_description: Tidebird is a New Blossom Class yacht designed by John Leather.

boatwithrank.name: Lena
boatwithrank.short_description: Lena is a Heard 23, bought as a bare hull and fitted out by her first owner.

boatwithrank.name: Sprite
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Sprite' is a conversion of a Royal Navy surf boat.

boatwithrank.name: Blue Gansey
boatwithrank.short_description: Blue Gansey was rebuilt by Ian MacGillivray in 2000. She is regularly sailed across the English Channel to French festivals, even though she is an open boat.

boatwithrank.name: Minx
boatwithrank.short_description: Taken to the East Coast in 1906 she returned to the Solent when owned by Paul Scivier from 1994.

boatwithrank.name: Joseph T
boatwithrank.short_description: Joseph T is an Oyster Smack built and designed by Howard in 1901.

boatwithrank.name: Sara
boatwithrank.short_description: Sara is of Wests treated plywood construction. An inshore cruiser with small two berth cabin and large cockpit for day sailing.

boatwithrank.name: Gaivota
boatwithrank.short_description: Pronounced Guy-votta, Gaivota is a gentleman’s yacht typical of the period.

boatwithrank.name: Le Rosbif
boatwithrank.short_description: Le Rosbif is a Ilur design built over 5 years by her first owner Chris Allender.

boatwithrank.name: Sulis
boatwithrank.short_description: Sulis was sold to young Mevagissy fisherman in 2004. He sailed her to France and back then converted her into a fishing boat.

boatwithrank.name: Will'o-the-Wisp
boatwithrank.short_description: 21 foot, lug rigged, glass fibre Yealm Crabber, open boat, with a centreboard built by Hockaday Brothers. She is a delight to sail.

boatwithrank.name: Avola
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Avola' is a fine example of a 1960s wooden cruising yacht. Designed as a 'one off' for the original owner just before the explosion of GRP production yachts.

boatwithrank.name: Marsaili
boatwithrank.short_description: Marsaili is a "Guillemot" class dinghy designed by Iain Oughtred and built by her first owner David Bewick.

boatwithrank.name: ADC
boatwithrank.short_description: 'ADC', built in 1895 by Aldous of Brightlingsea fished with the Barbrook family until the 1930s.

boatwithrank.name: Ghost
boatwithrank.short_description: Reuel Parker designed, built by her original owner, cold moulded Sharpie schooner with centerboard.

boatwithrank.name: Bluebell
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Bluebell' is the prototype for the range Smuggler 25, now known as Tradewind Atoll 25.

boatwithrank.name: Eleanor - B
boatwithrank.short_description: Gaff Rigged Cutter based on a Falmouth Quay Punt.

boatwithrank.name: Mai Star II
boatwithrank.short_description: One of three boats called Gadfly built for Mr H.C Doughty of Margate, who originally owned Gadfly in 1939. Her owner finished a long restoration ashore in September 2015 and completed her afloat over the winter months.

boatwithrank.name: Wildcat of Southwold
boatwithrank.short_description: Wildcat of Southwold is a Walker Tideway

boatwithrank.name: Letitia
boatwithrank.short_description: Letitia is a Dunkirk little ship, originally built for Arthur Dench and sold to Tom  around 1960. She was first registered LO220.

boatwithrank.name: Sea Jade
boatwithrank.short_description: Small boat, big ideas

boatwithrank.name: Sea Breeze
boatwithrank.short_description: Sea Breeze won 2nd Prize in the first Gaffers Race, Solent, 27 July 1959. The widow of her owner since 1947 sold her on his death, she was taken to Scotland. Her tiller is believed to be at the Maritime Museum, Falmouth.

boatwithrank.name: Jay Jay
boatwithrank.short_description: Completed in 2013, JayJay is a gaff rigged cutter of plywood and epoxy construction.

boatwithrank.name: Lianthe
boatwithrank.short_description: The 22' sloop 'Lianthe' was built by Charles Wiggins at Great Wakering in 1934. She was the first winner of the Old Harry Trophy in the OGA East Coast Race.

boatwithrank.name: Ariel
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1925 for 'under £300' Ariel is a well constructed and practical small cruising gaff cutter designed by Albert Strange.

boatwithrank.name: Reverie
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Reverie' was based on a Dan Hatcher design of 1890 and she has the same rig as 'Blue Jacket'.

boatwithrank.name: Stonechat
boatwithrank.short_description: Stonechat was built by the late Austin Edge for short-handed cruising in the North Sea. She is loosely based on a Colin Archer design.

boatwithrank.name: Excelsior
boatwithrank.short_description: Worked out of Lowestoft until 1935, then sold to Norway and converted to a motor coaster. Returned to UK in 1972 she was given to the Excelsior Trust in 1984. She was rebuilt and converted back to sail, 1985-88.

boatwithrank.name: Sophie Dawes
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Sophie Dawes' is a trailer sailor based on a design from the well known East Coast designer John Leather.

boatwithrank.name: Pioneer
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by Peter Harris at Rowhedge in 1864, Pioneer was originally 57 ft. overall length working out of Brightlingsea dredging deep sea oysters. Lengthened by Aldous in 1889, and having a "wet well", she's probably the last remaining UK sailing fishing vessel with one.

boatwithrank.name: Jacinta
boatwithrank.short_description: Jacinta is a Leigh Cockler

boatwithrank.name: Isobella
boatwithrank.short_description: Two berth cabin version of a Memory 19 built in 2006 by Salterns on the Hamble.

boatwithrank.name: Caryta
boatwithrank.short_description: She is a fine example of her type needing a bit of tlc.

boatwithrank.name: Blue Jack
boatwithrank.short_description: Standard Cornish Shrimper number 277 with outboard engine well

boatwithrank.name: Siren
boatwithrank.short_description: She is a nice example of her type.

boatwithrank.name: Band of Hope
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Band of Hope' sometimes referred to irreverently as 'Abandon Hope', is a Harwich Bawley still sailing under her original name in 1997.

boatwithrank.name: Passager
boatwithrank.short_description: Passager is ferro-cement, built in 1978, and fitted out in Lymington by her first owner over many years.

boatwithrank.name: Ferryman III
boatwithrank.short_description: Ferryman III is a 'one off' topsail schooner built in 1950.

boatwithrank.name: Mjojo
boatwithrank.short_description: Dhow hull, Bawley rig

boatwithrank.name: Windhover
boatwithrank.short_description: Windhover is an original wooden Drascombe Lugger.

boatwithrank.name: Mordialloc
boatwithrank.short_description: Mordialloc is a Mark 1 Cornish crabber

boatwithrank.name: Black Jack
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Black Jack' is a GRP Morecambe Bay Prawner built from a mould taken from the 'William Priestley' the Morecambe Bay Fishermen's Association's private lifeboat which served from 1934 to 1989. She was launched in 1990.

boatwithrank.name: Shamrock
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Shamrock' was built at Brightlingsea, 1900, by Aldous for the Page brothers of West Mersea mainly for spratting.

boatwithrank.name: Gimli
boatwithrank.short_description: Memory 19 built by Salterns in 2009.

boatwithrank.name: Nellie
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in Looe to dredge oysters on the Fal.

boatwithrank.name: Devon Maid
boatwithrank.short_description: Devon Maid was built at Belsize Boatyard on the River Itchen from off-cuts from their steam yachts, mainy larch with some cedar and oak. She raced in the first OGA Solent Race, 1959.

boatwithrank.name: Dart
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Dart' is a Mersey Rivers Class yacht, designed by Crossfields of Arnside and built in 1912.

boatwithrank.name: Rob Pete
boatwithrank.short_description: Built 1924 by Worfolk Bros., Kings Lynn 'Rob Pete' is a Kings Lynn shrimper. She fished until 1990 and re-launched 1994 after a major rebuild by William Cracknell.

boatwithrank.name: Bluemoon
boatwithrank.short_description: Built over eight years, from 1998 to 2006.

boatwithrank.name: Snowdrop
boatwithrank.short_description: Snowdrop is a Morecombe Bay Prawner

boatwithrank.name: Betsy
boatwithrank.short_description: Built at Cooks Boatyard Maldon 1930. 'Betsy' is 30 ft overall carvel planked pitch pine on oak timbers. Long keel with a canoe stern and Bermudan yawl cutter rigged.

boatwithrank.name: Clover
boatwithrank.short_description: Clover is a 68' Gaff Topsail Cutter built by A.R. Luke Bros. in Hamble in 1938

boatwithrank.name: Redwing
boatwithrank.short_description: Cornish Crabbers Pilot Cutter 30. Boat Show model in 2001.

boatwithrank.name: Fairy
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Fairy' is a 32' smack, designed and built in 1879 by John Howard in Maldon, Essex.

boatwithrank.name: Mary Hay
boatwithrank.short_description: Mary Hay is a Kite Class Gaff Sloop No. 2 designed by Andrew Wolstenholme and built by Dick Philips (Willow Bay Boats) at Lyme Regis in 2012.

boatwithrank.name: Maude
boatwithrank.short_description: Maude is a Tamarisk 29 based on lines taken directly from a Falmouth fishing boat of the early 20th century.

boatwithrank.name: Cypræa
boatwithrank.short_description: Wooden centreboard day boat built by Ned Williams in Cowes 1908. Restored by Jake Jefferies 2020.

boatwithrank.name: Dolphin of Leith
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1904, Dolphin of Leith has cruised extensively around the world. She is now based in New Zealand, having sailed there from the Solent, arriving February 2014.

boatwithrank.name: Apsara
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Apsara' was built by Ivan Jefferis at Bosham Hoe in 2004. She is traditionally built of larch on oak.

boatwithrank.name: Merwina
boatwithrank.short_description: Lapstrake, round bilged, beamy gaffer, a straight stemmed,  lightweight dayboat, with fore and after decks and two rowing thwarts .

boatwithrank.name: Young Alert
boatwithrank.short_description: The Solent Smack, Alert, was designed and built by Daniel G Hatcher in the 1860's. In 1946 she was completely rebuilt by Whisstocks and renamed Young Alert. Immediately after the war it was possible to get timber to rebuild yachts but not to build new.

boatwithrank.name: Charm
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1922, 'Charm' is one of several boats with the same name attributed to Albert Strange. She has had a chequered history, with more than one restoration.

boatwithrank.name: Mantis
boatwithrank.short_description: The Ballyholme Insect class is the same as the RNSA 14 but built for Ballyholme Yacht Club from the late 1940's.

boatwithrank.name: Robinetta
boatwithrank.short_description: Robinetta is a 22' 6" tabloid cruiser, designed by Denys Rayner and built for him by the Enterprise Small Craft Company, Rock Ferry, Birkenhead.

boatwithrank.name: Linnaea
boatwithrank.short_description: A 20ft Dauntless, Linnaea is of clinker construction, cutter rigged with high peaked gaff. She has in the past joined in most gaffers events on the East Coast and in 1993 she sailed through Holland to the Frisian Islands.

boatwithrank.name: Mincarlo
boatwithrank.short_description: Mincarlo is Gypsy no 19

boatwithrank.name: Prawle
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Prawle' was built as a yacht in 1965 on Breton fishing boat lines.

boatwithrank.name: Ellen
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Ellen' was built at Rowhedge on the River Colne, Essex in 1900 by Harris, renowned for his fast smacks.

boatwithrank.name: Amber
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1991 by Robert Fenton at Harwich Boatcraft. Amber's construction is epoxy coated marine ply.

boatwithrank.name: Maud
boatwithrank.short_description: An oyster smack built 1876 in Maldon.

boatwithrank.name: Helen of Hamble
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Helen of Hamble' is a Tamarisk 24 built in 1980. She was rebuilt in 2005-7 by Mike Brackstone with complete new internals, coachroof and cockpit.

boatwithrank.name: Beano
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Beano' is a 14ft gunter dinghy.

boatwithrank.name: Turtle
boatwithrank.short_description: Turtle is a heavy half deck day boat, built with a solid rock elm bottom board with strip planks iron nailed vertically, probably not expected to last more than a few years. she has now been sheathed with GRP. local rumour is that she was a farm boat shipped to Tilbury dock from North America just after WW2, she was owned by the marine artist Vic Ellis for many years

boatwithrank.name: Lapwing
boatwithrank.short_description: Lapwing is a Francois Vivier Jewel Class yacht built by her first owner.

boatwithrank.name: Dorothea
boatwithrank.short_description: Dorothea is a Morecambe Prawner.

boatwithrank.name: Alberta
boatwithrank.short_description: Alberta was built in 1885 by Aldous of Brightlingsea. Totally rebuilt at Barry Tester's yard at Hollowshore, 2002 - 2004, she is one of the fastest smacks sailing today.

boatwithrank.name: Quiz
boatwithrank.short_description: Originally built in 1872, Quiz lay at Ramsholt on the River Deben for many years until being rebuilt by Frank Knights, Woodbridge, 1981.

boatwithrank.name: Wagtail
boatwithrank.short_description: Wagtail is a 16ft gunter rigged, steel centerboard dinghy of the Northumberland One Design class built for the Royal Northumberland Yacht Club in the 60's. She is plywood construction in the Ashcroft method and believed to be sail No 10 of the class.

boatwithrank.name: Marjory
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Marjory' is a 16'9" Shilling gaff yawl designed and built by Phil Swift of Willow Bay Boats - in cedar strip/epoxy, 1998. She was the first Shilling he built.

boatwithrank.name: Happy Quest
boatwithrank.short_description: Happy Quest was built by her owner, David Grainger, 1977 - 1995.

boatwithrank.name: Blue Bell
boatwithrank.short_description: Blue Bell is a Tela built in 1991

boatwithrank.name: Chantey
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Chantey' was built in 1934 as an insurance replacement for a sister ship lost when AGH McPherson, Commodore of the Portsmouth Sailing Club, was returning across channel from Rouen.

boatwithrank.name: Mary
boatwithrank.short_description: Mary was a yacht untill 1909, then used for fishing by Cecil French until 1964.

boatwithrank.name: Noorderzon
boatwithrank.short_description: The steel cutter, Noorderzon, was built in the Netherlands, 1979. She was a regular winner in East Coast OGA events during the 1980s.

boatwithrank.name: Minelvia
boatwithrank.short_description: Minelvia was registered in Lloyds, 1953. She is a standard Hillyard 4 tonner built 1937 at Littlehampton.

boatwithrank.name: Cailleach Dhubh
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by Gaffers & Luggers, Tregatreath Boatyard, Cornwall in 1989, 'Cailleach Dhubh' is a Heard 23 gaff cutter based on the Falmouth working vessels.

boatwithrank.name: Shaula
boatwithrank.short_description: A Loch Fyne Cutter originally built on the Isle of Skye for fishing and converted to a yacht in 1989.     She has sailed as far as Norway and the Mediterranean.

boatwithrank.name: Arielle of Keyhaven
boatwithrank.short_description: Ariel is a Heard Tosher, she won the Solent Gaffers Annual Race in 1990.

boatwithrank.name: Mary Niven
boatwithrank.short_description: Mary Niven is a yacht built in 1939. She has been considered to be a Harrison Butler design, although Lloyds register give the designer as J.A.Orr, the builder.

boatwithrank.name: Andromeda of Wight
boatwithrank.short_description: One off cruiser Roy Loram modified a John Leather design. Built to be a live aboard with increased feeboard, raised cabin and flush cockpit

boatwithrank.name: Nora
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Nora', LR 59, was built for Robert (Rodding) Wilson by William Crossfield in 1912.

boatwithrank.name: Truant
boatwithrank.short_description: Truant is a Mark 1 Cheverton

boatwithrank.name: Hoshi
boatwithrank.short_description: Run by the Island Crusing Club out of Salcome for many years. Sold to France 2000.

boatwithrank.name: Norn
boatwithrank.short_description: Norn is a Venus 42 gaff rigged ketch designed by Paul Johnson and built in 1990. She has sailed extensively worldwide.

boatwithrank.name: Sovrana
boatwithrank.short_description: Sovrana is a Bermudan Ketch designed by Kim Holman

boatwithrank.name: Stargazy
boatwithrank.short_description: Stargazy is a Mark 1 Crabber 24 based on the Tamar. Standard specification with a gaff cutter rig.

boatwithrank.name: Bee
boatwithrank.short_description: Bee is a Tollesbury fishing smack converted to a yacht

boatwithrank.name: Sylvia Ruth
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Sylvia Ruth' is a traditionally built gunter rigged clinker dinghy.

boatwithrank.name: Thetis
boatwithrank.short_description: A lovely gaff-rigged dayboat, 'Thetis' is a 16ft 6in Salterns Tela, built 2004 in GRP with hardwood trim.

boatwithrank.name: Peggy Bawn
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Peggy Bawn' was designed by George Lennox Watson of Glasgow, Scotland and built by John Hilditch of Carrickefergus, County Antrim, in 1894. Following extensive restoration, she was relaunched in 2005 to cruise the Celtic Seas and beyond once more.

boatwithrank.name: Sarah Grace
boatwithrank.short_description: Sarah Grace is a Drascombe Scaffie with a loose footed lugsail.

boatwithrank.name: Friendly Spirit
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1988, Friendly Spirit was rebuilt 1997 - 2000 before being sold in 2004. She had another refit in 2010.

boatwithrank.name: Betty
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1913, 'Betty' has been owned and raced by OGA members since 1959.

boatwithrank.name: Wee Annie
boatwithrank.short_description: Phil Bolger designed Lynx

boatwithrank.name: Alice
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Alice', a Heard 35, was built in 2000 at Mylor, Falmouth. In 2016 she was exported to Antigua.

boatwithrank.name: Gracie
boatwithrank.short_description:
Pretty clinker design reminiscent of ships' tenders - she sails well, rows wel and tows well.

She takes 3 adults rowing or motoring and two adults sailing.

Quite high freeboard and slightly chubby - being a Nestaway she splits into 2 sections: the bow section fits inside the stern for easier transport and storage.

boatwithrank.name: Annie
boatwithrank.short_description: Annie is the first Pilot Cutter taken from the mould.

boatwithrank.name: Royal Oak
boatwithrank.short_description: Royal Oak, built by Bond’s in 1937, is the last remaining boat of the Dreadnought fleet built for West Kirby Sailing Club.

boatwithrank.name: Provident
boatwithrank.short_description: One of the last trawlers built to work under sail, 'Provident' fished for six years before being converted to a yacht. She has cruised extensively around the West Country and Baltic ports. After being out of service for more than a year, she takes part in the Brixham Heritage Sailing Regatta, May 2016.

boatwithrank.name: Ziska
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by Crossfields, Arnside, in 1903 Ziska is now based on the west coast of America. In 2019 she took part in the Race to Alaska. Ashley Butler, one of the country's leading wooden boatbuilders sailed her across the Atlantic in 1999.

boatwithrank.name: Molly Oxford
boatwithrank.short_description: Molly Oxford is a gaff cutter fitted out in 1989 by Robertsons of Woodbridge, based on a Heard 28 GRP hull built in Falmouth.

boatwithrank.name: Quinque
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Quinque' was built in 1911 at Everson's Yard, Woodbridge, Suffolk to a Sibbick design.

boatwithrank.name: Orion
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by de Groot at Gorinchem, South Holland in 1997, 'Orion' was deisgned by Beechcraft and has a steel hull.

boatwithrank.name: Amity
boatwithrank.short_description: Amity was built as a 37ft Beach Tripper Boat and became a cockler.

boatwithrank.name: Alicia
boatwithrank.short_description: Wylo Class built in 1995

boatwithrank.name: Guiding Star
boatwithrank.short_description: Guiding Star is a Looe lugger built in 1907 by James Angear for the Soady family and converted into a yacht in 1937 at Uphams yard in Brixham.

boatwithrank.name: Wilful
boatwithrank.short_description: Designed and built by C Sibbick of Cowes, 1899, 'Wilful' was once owned by Maurice Griffiths.

boatwithrank.name: Redwing
boatwithrank.short_description: The Ebihen 16 is a gaff cutter, clinker ply construction. Redwing was built during the Covid pandemic and kept the builder/owner sane! The boat was designed by Francois Vivier and is a stable heavy day-sailor.

boatwithrank.name: Mary Louise
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Mary Louise' is an Ebihen design, built in 2011. Designed by Francois Vivier, she is based on the traditional fishing boats of North Brittany and Normandy with the rig from the Morlaix/Roscoff area.

boatwithrank.name: Pinke Bill
boatwithrank.short_description: Pinke Bill is a standard GRP West Wight Scow.

boatwithrank.name: Princess Ida
boatwithrank.short_description: Under going restoration by Mike Cottam Southport

boatwithrank.name: Mareea
boatwithrank.short_description: The first owner bought the hull of a Salcombe Trader from Buccaneer Boats, and fitted her out himself.

boatwithrank.name: Growler
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by White Bros., 1922, 'Growler' is a1/3 size version of the Thames barge 'Sara'. She spent her working life on the East Coast of England.

boatwithrank.name: Puritan
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by Aldous and in a shed on the Hard at West Mersea from 2019

boatwithrank.name: Alert
boatwithrank.short_description: Alert is a Tumlare built in 1935.

boatwithrank.name: Aliesje
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Aliesje' was built for the then owner of Cornish Crabbers Peter Keeling and was named after his wife. Her "maiden journey" was to the 1996 London Boat Show. It is believed she is the only Bermudan rigged boat of her class, Cornish Crabber Pilot Cutter.

boatwithrank.name: Crabby Madge
boatwithrank.short_description: Crabby madge is a Cornish Pilot Cutter

boatwithrank.name: Tiki
boatwithrank.short_description: Tiki is a Padstow Lugger.

boatwithrank.name: Trasnagh
boatwithrank.short_description: Found as a bare hull, 'Trasnagh' has been restored to a very high standard, winning second place in the 2014 Classic Boat Restoration of the Year.

boatwithrank.name: Pathfinder 3
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Pathfinder 3' is a modern interpretation of the traditional canoe yawl designed for the home builder by Colin Cumming.

boatwithrank.name: Dagmar
boatwithrank.short_description: A one off yacht, designed by John Bain and built at Rosneath

boatwithrank.name: Citara
boatwithrank.short_description: Believed to have been built as a smack in 1887, named 'Rover', by Aldous of Brightlingsea, although she probably never fished owing to the state of the herring industry at the time. In 1895 she is listed in Lloyds Register as 'Citara', when it is assumed she was converted to a yacht.

boatwithrank.name: Idler
boatwithrank.short_description: 22ft long keel Gaff Cutter built by W. (Walter?) Wiggins in Gt Wakering in 1940.

boatwithrank.name: Lady Trix
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Thistle', previously known as 'Trix' until 1946, was built in Scotland, 1909 to an Alfred Mylne design. In 2006, she was renamed again, 'Lady Trix' following a major restoration in France.

boatwithrank.name: Ro-an-mor
boatwithrank.short_description: Ro-an-mor is built with traditional layout and GRP hull. Her designer Frank Argall based the design the Falmouth Workboats and a design of Warrington Smyth. She's well ballasted with lead keel making her very stable and comfortable for passage making.

boatwithrank.name: Mouse
boatwithrank.short_description: Cornish Crabber 17, built 2003 and sails under sail number 109.

boatwithrank.name: Vigilance
boatwithrank.short_description: Vigilance was the last beam trawler built at Upham's yard in Brixham, 1926.

boatwithrank.name: Nutmeg
boatwithrank.short_description: Most of Borwick's dinghies were built as rowing dinghies but some like Nutmeg were given an extra plank for sailing.

boatwithrank.name: Sula of Maldon
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Sula of Maldon', built in 1997, is a Kattegat Class designed by John Leather and inspired by Colin Archer.

boatwithrank.name: Ethel Alice
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Ethel Alice' was rebuilt 1995-6 and for sale in 2003.

boatwithrank.name: Diamond
boatwithrank.short_description: Diamond, CK250, is a Tyrrell & Young smack yacht.

boatwithrank.name: Dirk II
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by A H Arp at Laboe in Germany to a Fife design in 1921, Dirk II featured in a book written by her then owner Hans Domizlaff about his cruises in the Baltic in the 1920s. She was converted to a Bermudian yawl, then a Bermudian ketch.

boatwithrank.name: Polly
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Polly', fishing no. MN12, was a small Class III oyster smack built by the celebrated builder of spritsail barges, John Howard at North Street, Maldon, in 1889. She was the first winner of the Tom Bolton Memorial Cup at the OGA East Coast Race in 1964.

boatwithrank.name: Dabchick
boatwithrank.short_description: Dabchick is a glued clinker lugsail dinghy designed by Andrew Wolstenholme and built from scratch by Colin Stroud. Dabchick came second in the The Boatman magazine's Amateur Shipwrights Awards in 1995.

boatwithrank.name: Mary Helen
boatwithrank.short_description: Designed by John Tew, and built for him and his wife Helen to sail the Atlantic in 1937.

boatwithrank.name: Ferryman
boatwithrank.short_description: Ferryman was built at Warsash on the Humber in 1949. Her designer is listed as Tormentor Yacht Station.

boatwithrank.name: Lila of Cowes
boatwithrank.short_description: Lila of Cowes is one of two Wylo 35.5 steel gaff rigged cutters professionally built by Voyaging Yachts in East Cowes.

boatwithrank.name: Furstin
boatwithrank.short_description: Furstin is a Tamarisk 29

boatwithrank.name: Corncockle
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Corncockle' is a Heard 28 built 1993.

boatwithrank.name: Muriel
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Muriel', built in 1905 of pitch pine on oak was 'rebuilt' twice under the ownership of Paul and Pat Heighway. In 2017, she underwent another restoration and was relaunched in the summer . . .

boatwithrank.name: Quiver
boatwithrank.short_description: Converted from an open boat in the 1920s, she was lost 4 June 1971, wrecked on Les Triagoz Reef to the west of Les Sept Iles, North Brittany Coast.

boatwithrank.name: Swallow
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Swallow' is a Stornoway 9 built for the children as a rowing/sailing dinghy.

boatwithrank.name: Angele Aline
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Angele Aline' is a Dunkirk Little Ship and has been sunk as a blockade ship twice, 1940 (St Vaast) and 1944 (Nieuport).

boatwithrank.name: Camilla
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Camilla' was built in 1894 by Alexander Robertson at his yard in Sandbank, Argyll.

boatwithrank.name: Veryan
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Veryan' is a fine example of a Falmouth Quay Punt. Built in 1908

boatwithrank.name: Motley Croo
boatwithrank.short_description: Blue hull, red sails.

boatwithrank.name: Galatea
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1912 as a West Country pilchard boat, 'Galatea' was converted to a four-berth yacht in the 1930s.

boatwithrank.name: Sauntress
boatwithrank.short_description: Sauntress is a 28' gaff cutter built by Wright and Harris, designed by Wright, in 1913, Cardiff, Wales.

boatwithrank.name: Ivy Green
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 2003 at the Elephant Boatyard, 'Ivy Green' spent ten years on the East Coast before returning to Solent waters in 2014.

boatwithrank.name: Laura
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Laura' was built for J H Atkey, of Pascall Atkey & Son, Yacht Chandlers, Isle of Wight. Originally an open boat she was decked over in 1910. In her early days she was used to transport chandlery across from the mainland.

boatwithrank.name: Naiad
boatwithrank.short_description: Naiad, designed by Harrison Butler and built in 1936, was kept on the Solent by Vice Admiral J.W.S Dorling until 1961, when G.A Percival moved her to Northumberland.

boatwithrank.name: Vivette
boatwithrank.short_description: Centreboard gaff ketch, built Pin Mill by H. King & Sons in 1936, designed by Fred Shepherd, MINA.

boatwithrank.name: Maid Marion
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Maid Marion' is a very attractive small gaff yacht that sails well and has many original features.

boatwithrank.name: Bilanbil
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Bilanbil' is one of a few remaining Walton and Frinton One Designs, with sail no. 5, built by Halls at Walton on the Naze.  The class was designed by Morgan Giles, who also designed a number of other local one designs such as the better known Thames Estuary ODs and Essex ODs.

boatwithrank.name: Mahler
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Mahler' was built in 1983, a ferro-cement Norsk 35 gaff cutter. Following a refit, Terry Coles sailed her from the south of England to the Caribbean and back.

boatwithrank.name: Dorcis
boatwithrank.short_description: An Albert Strange yacht, believed to have been lost in 1965, has been found in the East Coast OGA records, being lost at sea, 1974.

boatwithrank.name: Swefn
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Swefn' is a Morbic 12 designed by Francois Vivier.

boatwithrank.name: Jezebel
boatwithrank.short_description: Jezebel is a Crabber 17 built in 1998.

boatwithrank.name: White Moth
boatwithrank.short_description: 'White Moth' is a classic gaff ketch, built 1903, by Major RF Wykeham Martin, designer of the famous headsail reefing gear.

boatwithrank.name: Mizpah
boatwithrank.short_description: Mizpah is a 1907 Seaview Mermaid design by G U Laws.

boatwithrank.name: Quintet
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Quintet', a traditional cutter, with Bermudan rig, was built in 1953 to a design from the drawing board of Reg Freeman of Hordle near Lymington. She carried owner, Clive and first mate Les on their circumnavigation of Britain in 2005.

boatwithrank.name: Arthur Alexander
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in Fleetwood as a fishing boat for J H Bullock of Lytham, known as 'Tern', she was registered at Preston on 29 June 1894, PN64.

boatwithrank.name: Cachalot
boatwithrank.short_description: Cachalot is a gaff cutter built along similar lines to that of an East Coast smack. She was built as a private yacht by Robert Saunders of Folkstone between 1897 - 1900 and has a fascinating history. She is a Dunkirk Little Ship and was relaunched in 2017 following a major 10-year refit, ashore at the head of the River Deben, Suffolk.

boatwithrank.name: Williams II
boatwithrank.short_description: The 'Williams II', formerly 'Haabet', a Baltic Trader built in 1914, will set sail for the Antarctic in 2019.

boatwithrank.name: Recipe
boatwithrank.short_description: Recipe is  Norfolk Smuggler, now being sailed in Zeeland

boatwithrank.name: Hetty Pegler
boatwithrank.short_description: Hetty Pegler is a Mark 1 crabber, modified to a mark 2 rig

boatwithrank.name: Carlotta
boatwithrank.short_description: Carlotta is a Heard 28 built in 1993.

boatwithrank.name: Amanita
boatwithrank.short_description: Nick Skeates' 35' Wylo II design built in steel between 2003 - 2015 by Mike Hill at Thakeham, Shoreham & Prinsted in Sussex. Launched 2009 at Shoreham.

boatwithrank.name: Harbinger
boatwithrank.short_description: There is little known about the history of 'Harbinger' before 1970, though she was built on the IOM before 1917, when the last Nobby was launched.

boatwithrank.name: Psyche
boatwithrank.short_description: Psyche's hull was built in 2000 by Spirit Yachts on the River Orwell, Suffolk, England and fitted out at Dolphin Quay in Chichester.

boatwithrank.name: Diamond
boatwithrank.short_description: Diamond was a Blackpool and Fleetwood Yacht Club Jewel Class Boat built by Crossfields in Arnside in 1912. All the boats were named after Jewels. The Royal Mersey Rivers Class were based on the Jewel Class

boatwithrank.name: Hetaire
boatwithrank.short_description: The Rouiller Brother's "Norwegian" boats (2 were built for use on Lake Geneva) are a light displacement version of the classic Norwegian double-ended cutter, with at "fin keel" below a shallow V hull. After WWII, due to lack of copper rivets, planking had to stop for 1 year, and due to lack of lead, an iron scrap in concrete keel was used. I am now in the process of rebuilding the keel fin  + lead bottom, and plan to launch Hetaire summer of 2021\. (The "Hetaires" were the consorts of Greek philosophers!)

boatwithrank.name: Hanser
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Hanser' was designed and built for Nigel & Jean Willimot as a fast weekend sailer. Her hull is representative of the long narrow monohulls built for racing in the 1960s with deep high aspect ratio keel and rudder.

boatwithrank.name: Blue Moon
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Blue Moon' is a 14' marine ply sailing dinghy called a Fyne Four, buiit from a kit, glued and coated with epoxy resin with gunter rig.

boatwithrank.name: Newty
boatwithrank.short_description: Newty is a gunter rigged boat built around Morecambe by Character Boats. She is 12ft 6in without bowsprit which is 18" long.

boatwithrank.name: Ester
boatwithrank.short_description: Ester is the first Oysterman 22, built, 1986

boatwithrank.name: Chickpea
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Chickpea' is a 30' (LOD) gaff-rigged cutter, built 1990, with hull and deck in GRP. The plug was an original Victorian gentleman's cutter, 'Fortuna' (circa 1880).

boatwithrank.name: Equinox
boatwithrank.short_description: Equinox is a 24 ft. 6" Cornish Crabber 24 built in 1999 and based in Chichester. Burgundy hull, two tone deck and tan mainsail, staysail and jib with a red and white striped topsail.

boatwithrank.name: Our Daddy
boatwithrank.short_description: Our Daddy is a fishing lugger, built for AJ Pengelly of Looe. She was the last sailing fishing boat from a Looe yard. She ihas a gaff rigged main and lug sail on the mizzen mast.

boatwithrank.name: Charmina
boatwithrank.short_description: Built 1923 By Ernest Woods, Cantley, Charmina is pitch pine on oak frames. She has won many races in the Solent area, and has been a wonderful family cruising boat.

boatwithrank.name: Cyrus
boatwithrank.short_description: Built by Buccaneer Boats and launched in 2005, 'Cyrus' was purchased as a home completion project in 1998.

boatwithrank.name: Trefoil of Kames
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Trefoil of Kames' is a Bermudan masthead sloop, built in 1950.

boatwithrank.name: Vindilis
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Vindilis' was Harrison Butler’s own boat built in 1935 to replace his Plymouth Hooker type gaffer named 'Sandook'.

boatwithrank.name: Our Boys
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Our Boys' was built by Richard Pearce for the Woodrow Pengelly family and registered for fishing FY221.

boatwithrank.name: Bunty B
boatwithrank.short_description: American Shoal Draft Ballasted Day Sailer/ Weekender

boatwithrank.name: Bird of Dawning
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Bird of Dawning' is a smack yacht, built for H Kemloe and launched on 17 July 1937. She's designed on the lines of an Essex oyster smack.

boatwithrank.name: Tern
boatwithrank.short_description: Tern is a Belfast Lough Design built in 1897.

boatwithrank.name: Plum of Mylor
boatwithrank.short_description: Plum of Mylor is a Heard 23. Often sailed single handed and a regular participant at the East Coast OGA events.

boatwithrank.name: Saoirse
boatwithrank.short_description: She's a real one-off.

boatwithrank.name: Hope
boatwithrank.short_description: Hope is a one-off clinker dinghy designed and built by Jonny Burke at Govan, Glasgow

boatwithrank.name: Cleone
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Cleone' is listed in Lloyds Register of Yachts from when it began, and was known to be racing in 1870. Mike Wright spent ten years restoring her.

boatwithrank.name: Dayspring
boatwithrank.short_description: Cruising version of the Falmouth Working boat similar to the Heard 28 and the Tamerisk 29

boatwithrank.name: Lizzie Girl
boatwithrank.short_description: LIzzie Girl is a GRP/clinker lug rigged dinghy with a dagger board and a mast in a tabernacle.

boatwithrank.name: Beagle of Woodbridge
boatwithrank.short_description: Beagle of Woodbridge is a Cornish Trader.

boatwithrank.name: Leona
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Leona' is a canoe yawl built 1906, Leigh on Sea. She has a single gaff headsail and lug mizzen.

boatwithrank.name: Firecrest
boatwithrank.short_description: The Golant Gaffer is a superb gaff cutter mini cruiser, designed by Roger Dongray

boatwithrank.name: Greenshank
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1914, 'Greenshank' was altered from sloop to yawl in 1922.

boatwithrank.name: Speedwell of Cremyll
boatwithrank.short_description: Speedwell of Cremyll is a 49' Buchanan yawl, built in 1962

boatwithrank.name: Irene V
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Irene V' is a Memory 19, built in Liverpool, 1970.

boatwithrank.name: Morning Calm
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Morning Calm' is a gaff sloop 19' Memory class built in 1978.

boatwithrank.name: Pleione
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Pleione' was built in West Mersea by William Wyatt to a John Leather design in 1960.

boatwithrank.name: Martha Kathleen
boatwithrank.short_description: A massively strong gaff ketch, 'Martha Kathleen' was designed by Arthur Holt and built by Holt & James, Heybridge, 1977. Intended for short-handed cruising off the Western Isles she has a gaff ketch rig, breaking the sail area down into easily managed sails, a powerful Thorneycroft 50 engine and lots of space.

boatwithrank.name: Wonder
boatwithrank.short_description: Wonder is an Itchen Ferry built in 1860 and still sailing on the East Coast of England.

boatwithrank.name: Punka
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Punka' is a cabin version of the popular Memory 19.

boatwithrank.name: Diric
boatwithrank.short_description: A classic gaff cutter, built 1938 by Elkins of Chichester, 'Diric' takes her name from her first owners Richard and Diane, who lived in Yarmouth IoW. She has also been called 'Diane'.

boatwithrank.name: Wild Pigeon
boatwithrank.short_description: Wild Pigeon was built in 1983 as a traditional gaff cutter by Terry Heard.

boatwithrank.name: Bonny
boatwithrank.short_description: Privateer 12'6"  Modified version of a Selway Fisher Highlander 12.  Gaff sloop with topsail

boatwithrank.name: Destina
boatwithrank.short_description: Destina is a Yonne Class, designed by Harrison Butler.

boatwithrank.name: Solveig
boatwithrank.short_description: Although not old by OGA standards Solveig has been around for a while but having been stored inside for a long period and rigourously maintained, she beautifuly built and is in terrific condition. Recently converted to a fully battened loose footed mainsail, the boat is easily handled and sails well.

boatwithrank.name: Annabelle
boatwithrank.short_description: Annabelle is a Cornish Crabber Yawl.

boatwithrank.name: Oyster Lugger
boatwithrank.short_description: 12ft Oyster Lugger based on the small working dinghys used on the Essex and Suffolk rivers at the ten of the century.

boatwithrank.name: Charm
boatwithrank.short_description: Charm sails regularly in events on the East Coast of England.

boatwithrank.name: Janey Bee
boatwithrank.short_description: She is a fine example of her type

boatwithrank.name: Sally J
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Sally-J' is a Heard 28, built in 1981.

boatwithrank.name: Jaunty
boatwithrank.short_description: Jaunty is a gentleman's yacht designed and built by Roy Marsden between 1960 and 1968 for estuary and river sailing.

boatwithrank.name: Anna Ellidi
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Anna Ellidi' is a Nobby, fishing no. BW111, built as a yacht and only used for fishing in WWI

boatwithrank.name: Boru
boatwithrank.short_description: Sold by Hunters as a kit boat, she but seems to have taken a long time to complete. It's not clear which of the early owners actually launched her.

boatwithrank.name: Egret
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Egret' is a Highlander 18 designed by Selway Fisher Design and built by two sailing enthusiasts to an exceptional standard in 2005.

boatwithrank.name: Hirondelle
boatwithrank.short_description: Hirondelle was built on Guernsey in 1904. She was raced in the Guernsey regattas and used for fishing off Alderney.

boatwithrank.name: Madeline
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Madeline' is a Drascombe Peterboat that has cruised the South Coast extensively from Poole.

boatwithrank.name: Dirty Girty
boatwithrank.short_description: Dirty Girty was designed and built by East Coast OGA member, Robert Berk in 1993.

boatwithrank.name: Norwegian Girl
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1983 as a Bermudan sloop, 'Norwegian Girl' was re-rigged as a gaff cutter at Penpol, Cornwall in 1985.

boatwithrank.name: Eye of the Wind
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Eye of the Wind', when known as 'Nerak' in the 1970s - 1990s, was an active participant in Solent OGA events.

boatwithrank.name: Wanda
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Wanda' is a Harley Mead design built in the 1930s, originally rigged as a gaff yawl. In 1938 her mizzen was removed and she was refitted as a stem head gaff sloop. She is a very fast boat, close winded and wherever she travels will inspire and impress.

boatwithrank.name: Letty May
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Letty May', built 1978, is a Memory 19, shoal draft gaff sloop based on Brightlingsea workboats of about 1900.

boatwithrank.name: Poppy
boatwithrank.short_description: Poppy, previously known as Womble, is a John Leather design built by David Moss in 1985..

boatwithrank.name: Sir William Priestley mould
boatwithrank.short_description: Moulds taken from Sir William Priestley

boatwithrank.name: Flycatcher
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Flycatcher' is a dayboat, based on the catboats of New England whose original purpose was inshore fishing. She is designed to suit the shallow and sheltered waters of Chichester Harbour.

boatwithrank.name: Chiquita
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1937 at Mews in Fremantle ,Western Australia.  Sailed most weekends, usually day sailed but with the occaisional trip away.

boatwithrank.name: Summer
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Summer' is an open sail and oar lugger that can be sloop or cat rigged.

boatwithrank.name: Pintail of Morra
boatwithrank.short_description: Sold at the Amsterdam Boat Show, 1977 and owned in Holland until 2007 when returned to Rossiter Yachts for a major refit.

boatwithrank.name: Mirelle
boatwithrank.short_description: Mirelle was designed by William Blake and built by Whisstock's in Woodbridge in 1937. She remained on the River Deben for 77 years, in three ownerships, until moving to the South coast in 2014.

boatwithrank.name: Westernman
boatwithrank.short_description: Built in 1997, 'Westernman' takes her name from the that of the pilots in the Bristol Channel and her design by Nigel Irens is an evolution of the renowned pilot cutters of the area.

boatwithrank.name: Rowan IV
boatwithrank.short_description: 'Rowan IV' was built in 1938 on the lines of a Loch Fyne skiff.

boatwithrank.name: Aeolus
boatwithrank.short_description: Aeolus is one of several (7?) 30 Square Metres built after Reimers death in 1986, by Jansson and Zarins in Koping, Sweden, to the lines of his last 30Sq.m design Natt och Dag (1972). She is of composite construction – the hull is foam sandwich in epoxy and glass - the deck is cold moulded with a teak coachroof and cockpit.

boatwithrank.name: Rocket
boatwithrank.short_description: Rocket is a Heard 28 built in 1980. The hull is based on a Falmouth working boat.

boatwithrank.name: Betty II

boatwithrank.name: Tussie Mussie

This Buchanan Norman is a classic traditional design from the board of the renowned Navel Architect Alan Buchanan 

A Masthead Sloop built by Frost & Drake Tollesbury Essex UK in 1961 to an amended design specification of Carvel Planking in Mahogany and Steam Bent Frames with Copper Fastenings

Decked in Mahogany with Teak Laid Decks Tussie Mussie is an eye to behold 

Owned by one family from conception but recently sold in 2021 to new owners

she is undergoing full restoration

Hull moulds also used for the Whaler rowing boats used annually at Dartmouth and Yealm Regattas.

Thorough overhaul and refit winter 2019 into Covid 2020 lockdown.

A fast hull design with a new powerful rig for 2022.
